greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between the prime indices of the two factors of the n-th semiprime.
comment: Are there no adjacent equal terms? I have verified this up to n = 10^6. - _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 04 2020
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The sequence of semiprimes together with the corresponding differences begins:
maple: A001358 := proc(n) option remember ; if n = 1 then return 4 ; else for a from procname(n-1)+1 do if isA001358(a) then return a; end if; end do; end if; end proc:
A176506 := proc(n) numtheory[pi](A084127(n)) - numtheory[pi](A084126(n)) ; end proc: seq(A176506(n),n=1..120) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 22 2010
N:= 500: # to use the first N semiprimes
for i from 1 to nops(Primes) do
for j from 1 to i do
if sp > N then break fi;
mathematica: M = 500; (* to use the first M semiprimes *)
SortBy[SP, First][[All, 2]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 18 2020, after _Robert Israel_ *)
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = {my(vsp = select(x->(bigomega(x)==2), [1..nn])); vector(#vsp, k, my(f=factor(vsp[k])[,1]); primepi(vecmax(f)) - primepi(vecmin(f)));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 18 2020
xref: A087794 is product of the same indices.
A176504 is the sum of the same indices.
A115392 lists positions of first appearances.
A338898 has this sequence as row differences.
A338912/A338913 give the two prime indices of semiprimes.
A024697 is the sum of semiprimes of weight n.
A056239 gives sum of prime indices (Heinz weight).
A087112 groups semiprimes by greater factor.
A270650/A270652/A338899 give the prime indices of squarefree semiprimes.
A338907/A338906 list semiprimes of odd/even weight.
A339114/A339115 give the least/greatest semiprime of weight n.
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Apr 19 2010
ext: a(51) and a(69) corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 22 2010
